intro: Cakile lanceolata var. australiensis, commonly known as the Australian bladderwort, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It is a member of the Brassicaceae family, characterized by its small, cruciform flowers and pungent odor. The plant typically grows in coastal and saline environments, showcasing its adaptability to harsh conditions. Its leaves are succulent and often covered in fine hairs, which help reduce water loss. The species is notable for its ability to thrive in nutrient-poor soils, making it a resilient and ecologically significant plant.
